title: Chinese Government donates 70 cars and 5 buses worth RMB 32.5 million to Guinea
description: On November 29, 2017, the Chinese Ambassador officially handed over 70 limousine cars and 5 buses to the Guinean Minister of Planning and International Cooperation. The total value of this donation was RMB 32.5 million (44,215,827,500 Guinean francs). The vehicles would be used to transport government officials.
combined_text:
# Sector
GOVERNMENT AND CIVIL SOCIETY

# Title
Chinese Government donates 70 cars and 5 buses worth RMB 32.5 million to Guinea

# Description
On November 29, 2017, the Chinese Ambassador officially handed over 70 limousine cars and 5 buses to the Guinean Minister of Planning and International Cooperation. The total value of this donation was RMB 32.5 million (44,215,827,500 Guinean francs). The vehicles would be used to transport government officials.
justification: Vehicle donation for government use without clear environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of 70 cars and 5 buses for government transportation purposes

title: Hanban sponsors establishment of Confucius Institute at Gamal Abdel Nasser University of Conakry
description: On July 28, 2017, the President of the Gamal Abdel Nasser University of Conakry confirmed that during his visit to China he signed an agreement with China's Linyi University to establish a Confucius Institute in Guinea (临沂大学科纳克里大学孔子学院). In October 2017, Linyi University and Conakry University signed the Implementation Agreement on Cooperative Construction of Confucius Institutes. At the end of December 2017, the Chinese Dean selected by Linyi University arrived in Guinea. After a further four months of preparation, the Confucius Institute was opened. On April 25, 2018, the Confucius Institute held a class opening ceremony where 89 officially registered students began class.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
Hanban sponsors establishment of Confucius Institute at Gamal Abdel Nasser University of Conakry

# Description
On July 28, 2017, the President of the Gamal Abdel Nasser University of Conakry confirmed that during his visit to China he signed an agreement with China's Linyi University to establish a Confucius Institute in Guinea (临沂大学科纳克里大学孔子学院). In October 2017, Linyi University and Conakry University signed the Implementation Agreement on Cooperative Construction of Confucius Institutes. At the end of December 2017, the Chinese Dean selected by Linyi University arrived in Guinea. After a further four months of preparation, the Confucius Institute was opened. On April 25, 2018, the Confucius Institute held a class opening ceremony where 89 officially registered students began class.
justification: Project focuses on educational and cultural exchange without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Establishment of Confucius Institute for Chinese language education, cultural exchange program

title: Chinese Government donates martial arts equipment to the Guinea Ministry of Culture, Sports, and Historical Heritage
description: On December 8, 2017, the General Administration of Sport of China officially handed over a batch of martial arts equipment to Guinea's Ministry of Culture, Sports, and Historical Heritage for use by the Guinea Martial Arts Association. The value of this donation is unknown.

title: Chinese Government donates sewing and embroidery equipment to the Guinea Women Self-Help and Promotion Center
description: On August 2, 2017, the Chinese Ambassador to Guinea officially handed over a batch of sewing and embroidery materials to the Guinea Women Self-Help and Promotion Center at the Cameroon Street Subdivision of Conakry. The value of this donation is unknown. This project falls under the China-Africa People-to-People Friendly Action framework agreement.

title: Chinese Government donates 30 motorcycles to the Guinea Ministry of Security and Civil Protection
description: On July 14, 2017, the Chinese Ambassador officially handed over a batch of 30 motorcycles to the Guinea Ministry of Security and Civil Protection. This donation was used to strengthen the Road Safety Bureau of the Ministry. The value of this donation is unknown.

title: Chinese Government donates equipment to Radio Télévision Guinéenne
description: On February 14, 2017, the Chinese Ambassador to Guinea attended donation ceremony of media equipment to Radio Télévision Guinéenne (Guinea Radio Television), the country's national broadcast station. The equipment included cameras, drones, and other unspecified items. The value of this donation is unknown. These items were intended to help Radio Télévision Guinéenne carry out their day-to-day work as well as "broadcast more programs produced by China, objectively introduce China, and promote a better understanding of China and the people of Guinea."
combined_text:
# Sector
COMMUNICATIONS

# Title
Chinese Government donates equipment to Radio Télévision Guinéenne

# Description
On February 14, 2017, the Chinese Ambassador to Guinea attended donation ceremony of media equipment to Radio Télévision Guinéenne (Guinea Radio Television), the country's national broadcast station. The equipment included cameras, drones, and other unspecified items. The value of this donation is unknown. These items were intended to help Radio Télévision Guinéenne carry out their day-to-day work as well as "broadcast more programs produced by China, objectively introduce China, and promote a better understanding of China and the people of Guinea."
justification: Project involves donation of media equipment for broadcasting purposes without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Donation of cameras, drones, and unspecified media equipment to national broadcast station for general broadcasting purposes

title: Chinese Government provides RMB 159 million grant for Phase 2 of the Alto do Bandim Fishing Port Project
description: After the completion of a feasibility study in April 2016, the Chinese Government and the Government of Guinea-Bissau signed a grant agreement for Phase 2 of the Alto do Bandim Fishing Port Project on July 25, 2017. China’s Ministry of Commerce was the source of funding and it committed RMB 159 million in total. Phase 1 of the Alto do Bandim Fishing Port Project was financed by the African Development Bank with US$4 million and it included the construction of a pier, a fish auction and an administrative building. Phase 2 involved the construction of a 50-meter-long floating dock, new breakwaters, administrative and fishery trade buildings, connecting roads, and drainage and sewage pipe networks within a 300-meter area.  China Railway Guangzhou Engineering Group Corporation (CRGEG) was the contractor responsible for implementation. On October 31, 2018, a foundation stone laying ceremony took place. Then, on March 22, 2019, Guinea-Bissau’s Minister of Fisheries, Adiatu Djaló Nandigna, announced that Phase 2 would be completed in the next two years. However, project implementation was temporarily halted in the spring of 2020 due to the COVID-19 epidemic. Work resumed on July 15, 2020. Then, on August 10, 2020, 25,000 cubic meters of silt were successfully dredged from the port. The project has passed mid-course inspection in 12/24/2021.
staff_comments: The Chinese project title is 板丁渔业码头援建项目 or 板丁渔业码头 or 援几内亚比绍板丁渔业码头项目 or 几内亚比绍板丁渔业码头 or 板丁渔业码头项目. The Portuguese project title is Segunda fase do porto de pesca do Alto do Bandim.
combined_text:
# Sector
AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY, FISHING

# Title
Chinese Government provides RMB 159 million grant for Phase 2 of the Alto do Bandim Fishing Port Project

# Description
After the completion of a feasibility study in April 2016, the Chinese Government and the Government of Guinea-Bissau signed a grant agreement for Phase 2 of the Alto do Bandim Fishing Port Project on July 25, 2017. China’s Ministry of Commerce was the source of funding and it committed RMB 159 million in total. Phase 1 of the Alto do Bandim Fishing Port Project was financed by the African Development Bank with US$4 million and it included the construction of a pier, a fish auction and an administrative building. Phase 2 involved the construction of a 50-meter-long floating dock, new breakwaters, administrative and fishery trade buildings, connecting roads, and drainage and sewage pipe networks within a 300-meter area.  China Railway Guangzhou Engineering Group Corporation (CRGEG) was the contractor responsible for implementation. On October 31, 2018, a foundation stone laying ceremony took place. Then, on March 22, 2019, Guinea-Bissau’s Minister of Fisheries, Adiatu Djaló Nandigna, announced that Phase 2 would be completed in the next two years. However, project implementation was temporarily halted in the spring of 2020 due to the COVID-19 epidemic. Work resumed on July 15, 2020. Then, on August 10, 2020, 25,000 cubic meters of silt were successfully dredged from the port. The project has passed mid-course inspection in 12/24/2021.
justification: Project focuses on fishing port infrastructure development without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Construction of floating dock, breakwaters, administrative buildings, roads, and drainage systems; no mention of energy or environmental components

title: China donates medical supplies to Guinea-Bissau in 2017
description: On May 31, 2017, China donated medicine and medical supplies to Guinea-Bissau's Canchungo Regional Hospital. The Chinese Ambassador to Guinea-Bissau, Jin Hongjun, as well as the Mayor of Canchungo, attended the ceremony. The director of Canchungo Hospital and Xie Wei, the leader of China's medical team in Guinea-Bissau, signed the certificate of the donation handover at the handover ceremony. This medical equipment handover project appears to be an annual event, as seen in previous projects such as #53246 in 2016. The value of this project is unknown. This project is completed.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
China donates medical supplies to Guinea-Bissau in 2017

# Description
On May 31, 2017, China donated medicine and medical supplies to Guinea-Bissau's Canchungo Regional Hospital. The Chinese Ambassador to Guinea-Bissau, Jin Hongjun, as well as the Mayor of Canchungo, attended the ceremony. The director of Canchungo Hospital and Xie Wei, the leader of China's medical team in Guinea-Bissau, signed the certificate of the donation handover at the handover ceremony. This medical equipment handover project appears to be an annual event, as seen in previous projects such as #53246 in 2016. The value of this project is unknown. This project is completed.
justification: Project is focused on healthcare support without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Donation of medicine and medical supplies to hospital, healthcare focus
